radiographic_examinations.findings: A less than 2-cm mass in the neck of the pancreas consistent with a pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Two years later, the pancreatic tumor had grown to 2.1 cm in size.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A 3.8-cm mass likely located in the distal body of the pancreas.
